fields.description: Chart macro not internatlionalized in the notation guide.
fields.summary: Chart macro help not internationalized

fields.description:
Currently a page copy to a new space results in the string "copy of" being pre-pended to the page title. 

Removing the pre-pended text before clicking Save results in the error "The title <page title> already exists in space <originating space>" whereas the page is not intended for the originating space!

The copy function should be updated to allow copying to a new space in a single step without having to edit the title.
fields.summary: Copying a page to a new space should not prepend 'Copy Of' to the copied page

fields.description:
When click "What's This?" link by page restrictions info, get error;


$action.getText('page.restrictions.help.title')

$action.getText('page.restrictions.description')

$action.getText('page.restrictions.permission.heirarchy.desc')

$action.getText('page.restrictions.permission.heirarchy.example')

$action.getText('page.restrictions.note')
fields.summary: Confluence - What's This? link near page restrictions note brings up error

fields.description:
Confluence will index as text any file which has a mime type which isn't clearly non-text, so Wink files, which have a mime type of 'Wink Document' get indexed as text.

Files created with [Wink|http://www.debugmode.com/wink/] give weird formated search results and much more irritating, the files let the search time increase several seconds per file.

How to verify?
1. upload confluence_test.wnk
2. wait for indexing
3. search for "teeest" (this word appears in confluence_test.wnk)
fields.summary: Confluence tries to index non text files as text, e.g. .wnk files crunch search

fields.description:
Confluence accepts form submissions from any source.  This means if you are logged in to confluence and another site submits data to the confluence instance, then its accepted without question (because the user is already logged in - or automatically logged in).

We need a way to validate the form submission.
fields.summary: Form submission doesn't check source

fields.description: See NotationGuideJP.pdf attached to CONF-6817
fields.summary: Bundled plugins without internationalized help text.
Support inline unformatted text
Remote API getSpaces does not return personal spaces
Moving page across spaces causes undesired text change in code and noformat macro

fields.description:
Writting Wiki markup as follows:

{{_stdcall_}}

and it is rendered as italic 

stdcall

Obviously, the underscores surrounding "stdcall" is not treated as normal text, but a font style indicator, which is not the documented behavior.

When posting C language code on Confluence, underscore-surrounded symbols are quite prevalent, and they should be displayed normally inside double curly brackets.
fields.summary: Text in double curly brackets are NOT always treated as no-format text

fields.description:
After the 2.4.5 upgrade to c.a.c, certain plugins with previously worked will no longer load. The two examples so far are

plugin repository 2.0.3.
doppler theme

The plugin repo works normally on a 2.4.5 standalone that I tested, as well as e.a.c and www.adaptavist.com, all 2.4.5.

The behaviour is as follows:

1. Attempt to upload the plugin, either using the plugin repo or the old-style plugin manager.
2. The file will upload, the page will return, with no messages, success or error, and the plugin will not be installed.
3. There are no messages of any  kind in the logs.
fields.summary: Certain Plugins will not load on c.a.c

fields.description:
- without autowatch, edits often go unwatched
- with autowatch, editors often subscribe to more pages than they want
- the point in the workflow when an editor decides if they want to watch a page they are editing is often WHEN they submit the edit.
- recommend creating a check box beside the 'minor edits' and revisions notes saying 'watch this', as on mediawiki, so users user can decide at the time of each submission if they want to watch future changes after this upgrade. (this preference could be sticky by user and page, or in the profile default on/off by user). will post as separate issue.
fields.summary: provide a 'watch this' checkbox during page edit submission form

fields.description:
CONF-630 was addressed with a general 'unsubscribe' link which brings the user to a long list (in my case 100's) of pages that I am watching and I need to find the page in order to unsubscribe.

Request was and is for a link, directly from an email, that will unsubscribe your watch from the SPECIFIC page that was sent in the email, rather than a two click unsubscribe process that requires first loading the page then clicking the notification icon.

This would need to differentiate between pages you recieved notification for because of space watches and those which are page watches.
fields.summary: Put a direct "unwatch this page" link in notification emails
after editing in rich-text and pasting content from another browser window the rich-text editor fails with error tinyMCE.getContent is not a function"

fields.description:
Access to /pages/ shows the directory listing as per screen shot 1.

Interesting 'undefined' edit opens up and I was not dare trying to save anything it it as it is on EAC.

/pages/createpage-preview.vm

Please investigate - this should not be able to be seen or accessed by outside world.
fields.summary: Accessing /pages/ shows velocity file listing

fields.description: While the Anonymous Access is enabled, page restrictions should not be allowed to be set by an Anonymous user. Currently when an Anonymous user clicks on the "Groups" search icon on the "Restrictions" link on "Edit" tab in a page, NPE is thrown (restrictions groups.txt error file is attached) and when the "Me" radio button is checked, and saved, NPE is thrown again (restrictions ME.txt error file is attached). Either the page restrictions should not be allowed for Anonymous user or a message should be issued to the user informing that an anonymous user cannot set page restrictions.
fields.summary: Anonymous user should not be allowed to set page permissions

fields.description: When referencing a long URL in a new Confluence page, the screen stops wrapping the lines. I have to scroll far over to the right to save the file, look at the quick help, or perform other options.
fields.summary: Shorten display text ("alias") used for long URLs so they don't break the page layout

fields.description:
When I log in as an admin and go to a space and click space admin and click permissions, then edit group permissions.  We have an Exchange server and I can see the groups we have created, which span two pages on your screen.  When I click "all" it only adds the first page.  That is problem 1.  It should all all pages, right?

Problem 2 is that if I click "all" on the first page and then add those, if I try to add the ones on page 2, I cannot see them.  I enter * and click find and they do not show up.  If I know one of their names and enter it, it will find it though.  It should find them when entering a *.

thanks,
Mark
fields.summary: Group Picker popup filters group AFTER extracting the page

fields.description: When editing a page, the cursor focus should switch to the Rich Text/Wiki Markup editor textbox. When adding a page, the cursor should focus on the page title. This will save time whenever a user performs these actions by allowing them to start entering text immediately.
fields.summary: Editor should apply focus to the textbox

fields.description:
After exporting the whole space from Confluence to PDF, all links between pages are "web links" instead of "local links". 

Please see the attached screen shots, sample pdf and space backup. This error also happen when the anchor macro is being used to reference other pages.
fields.summary: Links of PDF export from Confluence Space are all web links instead of local links

fields.description: At present, if a Confluence space admin allows Anonymous to remove attachments, web spiders can crawl and execute the removeattachment action.
fields.summary: Review GET methods in Confluence to ensure web spiders cannot execute dangerous actions (like removeattachment)

fields.description: Hyperlinks rendered in the title bar of the JIRA issues macro (title and refresh) should be specified using rel="nofollow" so that bots do not hammer the linked JIRA instance needlessly.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro should use nofollow for refresh and main title link

fields.description:
(Setting under Administration > General Configuration)

We should word it to something like 'Maximum Attachments per Upload' as it is confusing to users and can be misunderstood as 'per page'.
fields.summary: Rename 'Maximum Attachments per Form' setting to "... per Upload"
Favicon customization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8246].
  {panel}

We are starting to archive more email into Confluence, and suddenly hit upon an unfortunate limitation. Currently, you can add multiple pop accounts to a space, but there is no way to view the mail to each account separately. So the heavy flow accounts completely swamp all the others. The alternative which we've been using is to create a space per account, but we are starting to see that this doesn't scale very well.

Some thoughts:
* if more than one account is archived to a space, then the account name should be shown as a sortable column
* if more than one account is shown, it would be good to have a summary page listing the accounts, where clicking on an account would show just its email
* similarly when searching it should be possible to see which account the email was going to
* I would also like to see the account name in the URL so that it is clearer what you are looking at

It would also help if the main mail page looked more like a page in the space:

e.g.

http://wiki.progress.com/display/sup/mail/

not:

http://wiki.progress.com/spaces/viewmailarchive.action?key=sup

Apologies if this has been added since 2.2.2. We are planning to finally upgrade in the next month or so.
fields.summary: Improve handling of multiple email accounts archived to one space
For mail archiving, show also recipient information (that is the the "To:" and "CC:" fields of the email header)

fields.description:
1\ Confluence does not support versioning across several pages, a major requirement if Confluence is to be used as Requirements Engineering tool. 

2\ To be able to support attaching a label to a specific version of a page (labels that do not float with the page revisions)


Please refer to the attached document on the exact requirements in Confluence is to be used as Requirements Engineering tool. Please refer to the following URL for more details:

http://www.computer.org/portal/cms_docs_software/software/content/promo/s2028_07.pdf
fields.summary: To support versioning across mutiple pages and be able to assign a label to a specific version of a page

fields.description:
The Global Activity Plugin is "broken" on a fresh install of Confluence 2.4.4.

The Title is broken on the Actual page, displaying: "$generalUtils.htmlEncode($periodName)"

And the statistics at the bottom show an java.io.FileNotFoundException indicating the macro has failed to render. Refer to attached screenshots for more details.

This problem was produced by installing a fresh instance of Confluence 2.4.4 and importing a backup from 2.4.2. It seems to be caused by missing index files that the plugin relies on to generate the statistics in the ../index/plugin/usage directory.

This can be fixed however, by rebuilding the search index. The statistics will appear normally however the page title will still be broken. Refer to screenshot for more details.

The Space Activity Data remains unaffected.
fields.summary: Global Activity Title not rendered

fields.summary: create-space-button macro throws NPE when using preview

fields.description: Currently we don't provide the ability to remove trackback links. This would be enable removal of unwanted trackback links from 'malicious' sites.
fields.summary: Provide remove trackback link

fields.description: Please consider an option to display a menu on the right side to include all links and children pages.  This would be much user friendly then have to scroll down to the bottom of the page to see the other links.  It would be nice to see the Spaces then the pages under those spaces in this menu.
fields.summary: Option to have Right Column Menu

fields.description:
After doing a search and selecting a page from the results list, using the back button to return the results page is unsuccesful.  A "Webpage has expired" message is displayed in the browser window.

We are currently running 2.4.4#707 but I have seen this behavior in our previous versions as well.

See this Forum post for more information: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257245748

I didn't see any new log entries as a result of clicking the back button but I included all of our logs anyway.
fields.summary: Using Back button to return to search results page causes "Webpage has expired"

fields.description:
We noticed that generating of header anchors was changed and our anchor links were broken. In v.2.2.9 was:

UTF8 not ASCII string

The code works properly everywhere. But in v. 2.4.4 is:

UTF8 not ASCII string

The code works properly in IE and Opera. Firefox can not work with anchors by an id, if the id contains not ASCII string (e.g. Russian). I can suppose it is not a Confluence bug, it is a Firefox problem. But it would be great if you could manage to find a workaround of the problem, e.g. rollback of generating of header anchors to v.2.2.9
fields.summary: Header anchors do not work in Firefox with non-ASCII characters

fields.description:
When the IMAPS connection times out on email polling once, the Confluence server doesn't poll for email any more. When triggering the polling manually in the Web interface the server claims to be currently polling the email account.

The only remedy seems to be a server restart.

I am just speculating here but it looks like the Quartz thread that is responsible for email polling terminates because the exception is not caught.

When the error occurs, the following lines can be found In atlassian-confluence.log:

2007-02-14 19:57:09,085 ERROR [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-3] [atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager] retrieveMessages Error connecting to IMAPS account [cisdwik
i@rinn.ch@mail.genotec.ch:993] for space CISDInt: Error connecting to mail server: Connection timed out;
  nested exception is:
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
javax.mail.MessagingException: Connection timed out;
  nested exception is:
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.protocolConnect(IMAPStore.java:441)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:233)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.getStore(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:256)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.retrieveMessages(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.poll(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.poll(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:59)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.pollAllSpaces(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:242)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor306.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:284)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:155)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:122)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:56)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:144)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:174)
        at $Proxy35.pollAllSpaces(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.jobs.MailPollJob.executeJob(MailPollJob.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeInternal(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:44)
        at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:66)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:203)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
fields.summary: Confluence stops polling for email when connection times out

fields.description:
FAQs are intensive to maintain and prone to human error, especially those that that use the {include-page} macro. Below is an example of how multi-page FAQs are currently constructed, though this applies to FAQs on a single page as well.

--- Page A ---
# [FAQ Title 1|#entry1]
# [FAQ Title 2|#entry2]

{include:Page B}
{include:Page C}

--- Page B ---
h3. FAQ Title 1 {anchor:entry1}
FAQ Content 1

--- Page C ---
h3. FAQ Title 2 {anchor:entry2}
FAQ Content 2

This has the following disadvantages:
1) Anchor links and FAQ entry titles must be entered twice
2) Naming conventions for anchors must be strictly enforced and should be non-numeric so that entries can be added or removed later. This results in long anchor names
3) Risk that anchor links will point to anchors that do not exist or a duplicate anchor

A layout that solves the above problems could be as follows:

--- Page A ---
{faq-index}
{include:Page B}
{include:Page C}

--- Page B ---
{faq} FAQ Title 1
FAQ Content 1
{faq}

--- Page C ---
{faq} FAQ Title 2
FAQ Content 2
{faq}

The above solution is easier to write and maintain. Note that the FAQ macro will process the first line of the macro body as the title, stripping off any leading spaces in the title.

Optional:
- Allow individual entries to appear in multiple indexes based on labels. This will permit an FAQ entry applicable to multiple topics to be indexed to them both. If an entry is marked with labels, eg {faq:label=A,B} it will be listed by any FAQ indexes set to look for that label, eg {faq-index:label=A} will show only FAQ entries labelled with A. The basic {faq-index} would show all labels
- Allow heading variables, ie {faq-index:heading=h3} and {faq:heading=h3} where heading is a range from h1 to h5 and the default is h3
- FAQ index titles should be able to include links, images and thumbnails
fields.summary: Support for managing FAQ entries, indexes and searching

Better UI for cache size modification

fields.description:
From 

   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+the+%27Mail+Page%27+plugin?focusedCommentId=37453833#comment-37453833

"The link to the page that is generated is not ok for news: miss the date. I t would be better to use the tiny link."

Rather than use the tiny link, make sure you always use content.getUrlPath() when getting the URL for a content object/.
fields.summary: Mail Page plugin sends broken links to news

fields.description:
3 cases happend within 5 minutes:

- user 1 opens a page with no labels and begins editing
- user 2 adds a label to the page
- user 1 saves page
- user 2 refreshes page: there are no labels

- user 1 opens a page with a single label begins editing
- user 2 removes that label and adds 2 other labels to the same page
- user 1 saves page
- user 2 refreshes page: there is now just the original labels

- user 1 opens a page with a single label (with 3 labels)
- user 2 removes the single original label but leaves the 2 other labels to the same page
- user 1 saves page
- user 2 refreshes page: there are now three labels again
fields.summary: changed labels are reverted if another user saves an already open draft

fields.description:
It'd be nice if Confluence offered a "GO" type search where the search automatically went to the first result.  I use Firefox alias'ed bookmarks to search our wiki easily with "w xxx"and I find this faster than navigating to a page when I know the title.  My target page is almost always the first one in the result list, so it'd be nice if I could use "wgo xxx" and just go straight to the first result and save me a click.

The search string might be

http://wikidosearchsite.action?searchQuery.queryString=xxxx&searchQuery.spaceKey=conf_global&go=true

or something similar (note "go=true")
fields.summary: Wiki "GO" search
Create Space Problem

fields.description:
Webwork components rendered with the onofflist.vm template use an id of "radio_on" and "radio_off" for the on/off radio button options. These radio buttons are rendered with HTML labels associated with them via the "for" attribute. 

If more than one such component is rendered in a page, the non-uniqueness of the radio button ids causes clicks on labels to be passed to the first component of the page and not the one that the label is visually adjacent to.
fields.summary: On/off list components have inappropriate HTML IDs

fields.description:
Received a call from Apple today asking whether we could add support for attachments for files from the Apple Pages and Apple Keynote programs. Both of these file types are interpreted as directories in Windows but in an Apple OS they show up as files. When trying to add them as attachments from an Apple machine they are either not added (Firefox) or result in an error (Safari).

*Work Around Information*

For iWork '09:
# Preferences -> General:
# Untick the option {{Save new documents as packages}}

This work around will not affect existing documents.

For Pages 5.x:

# Right click on the Pages Document, and click {{Compress "Document Name"}}
# Attach the compressed document to the Confluence page

Pages 5 appears to have removed the ability to save pages as flat files. While it is possible to export the file in Pages '09 format (flat file); opening such a document in a newer Pages will ask the user to upgrade the format on saving.
fields.summary: Attachment support for Apple Pages and Keynote format files
When printing tables using the mac version of Firefox 2.0.0.3, not all lines of the tables consistently print.
Tab indexes of elements in the create/edit page should follow the order of which they appear

fields.description:
a blog-post macro, in a comment, renders as just the name of the macro with curly brackets, and does not seem to run the macro. However, the email notification that I got for the comment showed me the contents expected to be generated if the blog-posts macro was run.

See this comment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Include+Page+Macro?focusedCommentId=32899333#comment-32899333

I'll try to attach an html version of the email I got
fields.summary: blog-posts macro is disabled in comments, but still enabled in the email notification related to the addition of the comment.

fields.description: When using 'Mail Page' plugin, the link (to the page) that is generated is not ok for news: miss the date. It would be better to use the tiny link.
fields.summary: Using page mailing, page link is not ok for news

fields.description:
The online help that you access from the Edit Menu has the following in the Advanced Formatting page...
"All the optional parameters of {panel} macro are valid for {noformat} too."

However, when a user added the title parameter to his noformat macros he discovered that the toc-zone macro only listed every other heading in the toc.
In testing this for the user, I created a generic example and discovered this was consistent and could easily be reproduced. 
Then, when I used the toc macro instead of toc-zone, the results were even worse. 

Both files' contents are attached as text files. The first 6 headings use the same setup with the panel macro. The second are identical except they use the noformat macro. Graphics are attached to show what I see. Note that both sections should show all 6 headings. 

To test if title was really the problem, the title parameter was removed from each noformat heading and each file immediately produced a perfect toc.

Remove the titles in the example files to see the results.
fields.summary: adding option of title to noformat macro breaks the toc macro and interferes with toc-zone macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8219].
  {panel}

DefaultOSUAccessor contains references to instances of
   bucket.user.providers.CachingAccessProvider
   bucket.user.providers.CachingCredentialsProvider
   bucket.user.providers.CachingProfileProvider
,all of them are not serializable.

I propose making these classes serializable, which will require, in particular, refining their logs and caches.
fields.summary: com.atlassian.user.impl.osuser.DefaultOSUAccessor sometimes cannot be serialized
Improve time to summarise large text files

fields.description:
When moving an attachment from one page to another and using the update links option, the correct behaviour is to update any page that has a link/reference to the attachment that has been moved. 

What is happening in Confluence is that any page that has a reference to any attachment on the page will ALSO be marked as updated. This is incorrect behaviour as only pages that reference the attachment that was moved should be notified.
The resulting effect on production instances is that users will be incorrectly "spammed" with update notifications.
 
Updating Links updates all pages with reference to ANY attachment on the page from which was moved from.
fields.summary: When moving attachments, the "update links" option updates ALL pages with reference to ANY attachment on the page

fields.description:
When an update is performed on a transactional cache from outside of a database transaction the following warning appears in the logs:

WARN [http-8080-Processor20] [atlassian.confluence.cache.TransactionalCacheFactory] before Transactional cache update outside transaction

This should be changed to offer advice on how to fix the problem:

e.g.

"Transactional cache update outside transaction. All updates on this cache should be performed from a thread with a valid transaction context"
fields.summary: Non transaction cache updates should have clearer warning message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8215].
  {panel}

The subconf plugin (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Subconf) has to hook into the attachment subsystem.
Unfortunately when I first wrote it, I couldn't find a clean way to integrate it.
Basically there is a delegating attachment manager that delegates to either the file based, database based or web dav based attachment manager based on a global setting.
The component names for these three managers is hardcoded in a bit of logic in the delegating attachment manager.
Further, I wanted to only delegate to the subconf attachment manager if svn integration was set up for a particular space.
I initially thought about just hacking the confluence spring xml file to replace the delegating attachment manager. But you can't even do that, as the classes for the plugin havent been loaded at confluence start up, so you get a class not found error.

So the nasty solution I came up with is this - get the spring app context, and inject my attachment manager in place of the file based attachment manager. This only works because the delegating attachment manager looks up the file based attachment manager every call, rather than having it injected at startup time.
This involves quite a lot of down casting of the app context and (ahem) a couple of calls to private methods.

So my question is - is there a better way to do this without the hack? I guess I need either a plugin point in the attachment sub system, or a more generalised method of replacing confluence components.
fields.summary: Make attachment manager / dao pluggable

fields.description: We have a fairly large Confluence install. The backup files are 250Mb.. Backups take around 25-30 mins at the moment.. During that time Confluence is nearly impossible to use. The CPU is locked on 100 percent.. Is there someway to lower the priority of the backup thread?
fields.summary: Wiki is impossibly slow to use during daily backup

fields.description:
The Jira Issues macro has a baseUrl parameter that changes the header link to the issue navigator.
This base URL should be used for every link in the rendering of the issues:
 - for icons,
 - links to issues,
 - etc...
fields.summary: Jira issues macro not using base URL correctly

fields.description:
Based On CONF-8078, if a user goes through the 'Forgotten Password' process, confluence will attempt to generate a new password.  

Confluence will then attempt to save the password which may not be accepted by crowd because it doesn't match the regular expression.

Based on code-reading this would throw an error message back to the user and not update (or email) anything.
fields.summary: Reset password functionality does not always generate valid passwords with Crowd integration

fields.description:
The source release for Confluence 2.3.3 has not been made available, due to CONF-8007.

Now that this is fixed, we need to provide the source distribution for customers using this version (the last stable release on the 2.3 branch).
fields.summary: Build source release for Confluence 2.3.3

fields.description: This is the umbrella issue to collate all issues related to the new \{code\} macro
fields.summary: Umbrella issue for New Code Macro

fields.description:
if I change the test user's password to '123456' I get this:

http://p7.safenet:8080/rpc/xmlrpc at ./test.pl line 20.
Creating client connection to http://p7.safenet:8080/rpc/xmlrpc at /usr/lib/perl5/5.8.3/Production/Oncampus/Confluence/Confluence.pm line 103.
Logging in matthew at /usr/lib/perl5/5.8.3/Production/Oncampus/Confluence/Confluence.pm line 105.
Result={faultString => 'java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: $Proxy44.login(java.lang.String, int)',faultCode => '0'}
FAIL: REMOTE ERROR: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: $Proxy44.login(java.lang.String, int)

and then when I change it to 'x123456' I get this:

http://p7.safenet:8080/rpc/xmlrpc at ./test.pl line 20.
Creating client connection to http://p7.safenet:8080/rpc/xmlrpc at /usr/lib/perl5/5.8.3/Production/Oncampus/Confluence/Confluence.pm line 103.
Logging in matthew at /usr/lib/perl5/5.8.3/Production/Oncampus/Confluence/Confluence.pm line 105.
Result='fUx0SY1COb'
OK at ./test.pl line 25
fields.summary: XML::RPC login API is broken if the user's password starts with a number

fields.description:
Editing text using the Rich Text editor in Firefox adds additional line breaks, \\ with each save.
For instance, the following wiki markup, 

{noformat}
{code:title=Bar.java|borderStyle=solid}
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.channels
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.database
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities.strings
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.xml
{code}
{noformat}

Appears as:

{noformat}
{code:title=Bar.java|borderStyle=solid}
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.channels
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.database
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities.strings
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.xml
{code}\\
\\
\\
{noformat}

and then as:
 
{noformat}
{code:title=Bar.java|borderStyle=solid}
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.channels
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.database
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.utilities.strings
uk.ac.notttingham.portal.xml
{code}\\
\\
\\
\\
\\
{noformat}

This issue is present with all text blocks, not just \{code} blocks
fields.summary: Extra \\ line breaks added by rich text editor near macros and images

fields.description:
We are currently shipping a confluence jar in the WEB-INF/lib of the standalone distribution. This shouldn't have any effect other than increasing the size of the distribution. This is because classes in WEB-INF/classes should override those in the jar as per the servlet spec. We should stop this from happening regardless.

An interesting point was raised about shipping the jar without classes in WEB-INF/classes. Patches could be unpacked to classes which would let us see at a glance what mods had been made to a Confluence instance.
fields.summary: Confluence jar shipped in standalone lib directory

fields.description:
See: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257245553

'page' is a reserved word in the Firebird db, and the getDescendents(page) method of the HibernatePageDao uses 'page' as an identifier. While we don't officially support Firebird, it shouldn't be too hard to use a different identifier, and at least remove this incompatibiity.
fields.summary: Custom SQL query on ancestors table breaks Firebird
Fix NPE for rpc tool to migrate confluence users to jira

fields.description:
Currently our javadocs for the renderer package are missing some classes. This could be because our javadoc path in the maven file is pointing to the wrong location.

Also, our latest link for the Confluence javadocs point to 2.3 and not to the current latest 2.4.
fields.summary: Renderer javadoc wrong

fields.description:
A user is allowed to create a username "Anonymous" which conflicts with the "Anonymous Users" who can use Confluence without logging in.   

Two scenarios where this inconsistency has been observed:

1) Dasboard:

In the recently updated pages,there is no clear distinction between the pages changed by "Anonymous" who is logged into Confluence and an anonymous user who is not logged into Confluence. The only difference being the logged in users (username is Anonymous) is underlined and the other is not. They both are spelled as "Anonymous" on the Dashboard.
A screenshot has been attached to highlight the problem.

2) Global Activity Plugin:

The username "Anonymous" is underlined with a different icon and the edits made by all other anonymous users are listed under "Anonymous Users" which is not underlined, and the icon is grey and different. 
A screenshot has been attached to highlight the problem. Here a clear distinction exists between the Anonymous confluence user and anonymous user himself.

The above behaviour is not consistent between the two scenarios. Either the username "Anonymous" should be reserved by Confluence or some kind of distinction is required between the two type of users.
fields.summary: Make 'Anonymous' reserve key word for username

fields.description: It'd be nice if Confluence offered a Blame feature (sometimes called Praise to be nicer) which showed the current page and who wrote each line.  SVN offers this feature and it can be very useful.
fields.summary: Blame feature to show who wrote each section in the current version

fields.description: recently-updated macro -> new parameter to control the maximum numer of entries shown.
fields.summary: recently-updated macro -> new parameter to control the maximum numer of entries shown.
Size parameter not trimmed in {create-space-button} macro

fields.description:
Currently there is a document for adding special characters in Confluence from the Custom-character map. Additional instructions are required for adding special characters not present in the character map.
The document that needs to be updated is: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Rich+Text-Inserting+Symbols
fields.summary: Documentation for adding Special Characters

fields.description:
The follow issue needs to be investigated and confirmed:

A customer has reported that they are seeing hundreds of the heartbeat requests within a few second period sent from the same machine. This could be due to the messages being queued from when the timer starts (near the top of the edit page) to when the edit page completely loads and the page is either very large or user didn't have WYSIWYG Javascript cached?
fields.summary: Hundreds of Hearbeat messages sent within a few seconds
Tree View of thread emails in Mail Archive
Daily updates email does not include notification of comments on news items

fields.description:
Because the fix provided for CONF-8050 uses a baseURL, it doesn't handle changes to the baseURL property properly and doesn't work well in multi-homed environments.

Need to change it to use a relative URL or be smarter about how it calculates the base url.
fields.summary: Cached TinyMCE Servlet doesn't handle BaseURL Changes or Multi-homed environment
Create Atlassian Supported US English pack

fields.description:
When Using the US and the British English packages within a same instance of Confluence, the following points have been noticed:

1) In the Administration screen, while setting the Global Default language, the languages are listed with their respective flags, but the text remains the same i.e. "English". This should be changed to highlight "US English" and "British English". A screenshot has been attached.

2)  In the "General Preferences" screen, for each individual user, the drop down list with the available language packs, does not have a clear distinction between US and British English. The Text is "English" for both the cases. Moreover the text specifying the current selection is also not clear with the text being "Site Default (English)". This should be again more specific to the type of English package being used. A screenshot has been attached.
fields.summary: Distinguish between US and British English Language Pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8182].
  {panel}

As of version 2.2.8, Confluence no longer sends html attachments as text/html, instead always setting them to be application/x-download.  
This change is described in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-389

This feature needs to be a preference in the administrative screens that can be switched on/off.  Right now the only way to turn it off is by modifying the Confluence source code.

This turned out to be a big deal for our users.  Within two days of the upgrade we got three customers complaining that they can no longer view the attachments in-line.
fields.summary: Ability to view html attachments in-line (instead of download) needs to be a preference

fields.description: It would be very nice to have per-user configurable skins/themes for confluence so that each person can view every page with a basic layout that works for them.  The ability to create customizable skins, along with a stock set of basic skins, would be the best.
fields.summary: per-user skins for confluence

fields.description: From the Confluence download page, all of the download links are broken (standalone and WAR)
fields.summary: Download links broken for Confluence 2.4.4

fields.description: When thumbnail is used with center, both are ignored. Worse, if you save then try to view it in wikimarkup the markup dissappears, so you can't work with the code.
fields.summary: for images, align=center doesn't work with thumbnail

fields.description:
This is because there is no meta data on the repository server.

Is this plugin ready for public release?

If so, what are the release terms (license/maintainer etc)
fields.summary: Updates to the Usage-Tracking-Plugin do not appear in the Repostiory Client

fields.description:
On CAC there are some pages that do not include the Omniture code.
This page has it:
 http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home
This page doesn't:
 http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UGS/Atlassian+User+Group+Sponsorship

(View source and look for the SiteCatalyst comments)

Could it be that the custom theme for the UGS space doesn't play well with the global 'Custom HTML' settings?
fields.summary: Bamboo theme doesn't include Custom HTML in header
On Firefox, Confluence table (using standard wiki markup) does not format column width when column contains {code} macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8173].
  {panel}

Original title: To set global permission for specific action e.g. to delete comment (delete their own comment)
Currently we are unable to set global permission for specific action e.g. to allow user to delete comment.
Now it seems that we need to go to each space (Browse Space > Space Admin) and assign it from there.
And we need to keep on adding the permission to every new space
fields.summary: To set global permissions as defaults for space permissions

fields.description: I was able to start the configuration setup process - connect to the database (using a datasource) - but failed when I tried to create the admin user.  See attached file for details.
fields.summary: Creation of Admin user failing in setup process with a ClassCastException on Sun AS 8.2 Platform Edition

fields.description: The Edit User groups gives distorted UI.The left hand side select box is ok ,but the right hand side select box does not come beside it,it comes way below.Both select boxes should come side by side.It functions well though,groups can be added or removed.Please see attachment.
fields.summary: Distorted UI for Edit User Groups in v2.4.3

fields.description:
It seems that links in comments are not tracked for changes.
It's reproducable on 2.1.8, 2.3.2, 2.4.3 (confluence.atlassian.com)
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a page A1
2. Edit page with content: [A1]
3. Add a comment with content: [A1]
4. Edit page A1: rename A1 -> A2
Expected:
   1. link in page body changed to [A2]
   2. link in page comment changed to [A2]
Actual result:
   1. link in page body changed to [A2] as expected
   2. link in page comment is [A1] and added with plus (+) which is wrong.
fields.summary: A link within a comment breaks when the linked page is renamed
Support IBM Informix Dynamic Server

fields.description:
All attachments where present russian letters are unaccessable to delete or rename with error "attachment not found"

But we are able to view or download it.
fields.summary: can't to rename or delete attachments with russian letters in it's filename

fields.description: The page version history page will display the current version twice at the top of the list, once as the CURRENT link and then again linked against a version number
fields.summary: Previous page versions view lists current revision twice

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8166].
  {panel}

Currently there is no way to view all changes made to a space since a given date. Such details are only available on a page-by-page basis.

I'd like to see a way that would let you view a list of all pages that have changed just by selecting a date, and drilling into them you'd see the version changes between current the version just prior to that date.

Additionally, it'd be nice to allow us to provide changes in a space export. Exporting a space means taking all content offline, either to hand off to someone in physical version or someone who does not have Confluence access. The problem is that for successive exports you don't know what changed without drilling into the space details (for me: going in Recently Updated, drilling into each page, finding the version prior to the date you exported it, and clicking to see the changes, then printing to PDF).

if this were up to me, I would include a checkbox on the Space export page asking me if I wanted to export Revisions as well. Unchecked by default. Next to it would be a date selector (disabled when Revision checkbox is not checked), which I could use to select a date. if checked, the export would then provide the version changes following each page's most current content -- similar to how the RSS feed displays changes (see attached). In color of course.
fields.summary: View space-wide changes since XXX date

fields.description: Described feature would be a nice addition to an editor, as some types of modifications of document are done better with in Wiki mode, and for a large document it is rather hard to locate position in document I wanted to change
fields.summary: Preserving position when switching between Rich Text and Wiki Markup modes

fields.description: We exported our spaces to migrate from one database server to another. After restoring the spaces, we lost both the labels attached to pages as well as the change history.
fields.summary: When exporting a space to restore on another system, change history is lost

fields.description:
If Confluence is running in shared mode and there are no space groups, space creation is impossible.

A field error is generated by the validation code saying "A space must be assigned to a space group" and then not displayed.

*Workaround:* disable shared mode.
fields.summary: Space creation broken when running Confluence in Shared Mode and not having space groups

fields.description:
Once you have edited a page, base URL changes will have no effect on the location the editor javascript is requested from, so the editor may not load.

To work around this, restart Confluence and empty your browser caches.
fields.summary: Rich text editor fails to load because ConfluenceTinyMCEServlet doesn't notice base URL changes

fields.description:
I have tested two different versions of the "livesearch" macro on two different versions of Confluence and have found the following errors.

Tested on Confluence 2.2.10 and 2.4.2 WAR versions.
Tested livesearch.jar and livesearch-2.4.2jar.

livesearch.jar was found to be strict with syntax:
1. spacekey must be defined otherwise livesearch fails to render with a java.io.IOException
2. cannot specify more than one spacekey, it will break the livesearch macro and return zero results.
3. cannot have multiple instances of the livesearch macro on the same page. Only the first embedded livesearch macro will work, the rest will result in zero search results.

livesearch-2.4.2.jar was found to contain the following bugs:
1. cannot specify more than one spacekey, it will break the livesearch macro and return zero results.
2. cannot have multiple instances of the livesearch macro on the same page. Only the first embedded livesearch macro will work, the rest will result in zero search results.

livesearch-2.4.2.jar allowed usage without defining a spacekey, allowing searching through all spaces. livesearch.jar did not allow this.
livesearch.jar had a ajax script which showed search results in a little popup before the user needs to click on 'go'. livesearh-2.4.2.jar did not have this. Additionally, the ajax box did not appear in Confluence v2.4.2 when using livesearch.jar - refer to screenshot.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro syntax bug

fields.description:
On various pages on CAC we say that we support various software products "and above".  This essentially commits us to supporting any new version of those products that comes out, as soon as they come out, no matter what weird changes they make or bugs they introduce.  That is not a practical promise to make.

Examples are:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/List+Of+Supported+Application+Servers
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/List+Of+Supported+Databases   (This uses + instead of "and above).
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Confluence+EAR-WAR+edition
fields.summary: Should not say we support version x "and above"
Enable comment content layout to be editable in admin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8158].
  {panel}

All,

If I'm busy working away and I want to Save ... AND THEN CONTINUE ON ... why does Confluence presume to throw me right back to the start of the document and move me out of editing mode?

Perhaps I'm bringing a word processing ethic into a different medium, but to my mind, I haven't asked to do anything other than commit my work...
uber-frustrating and time consuming ... perhaps a SAVE&CONTINUE button? if there's good reasoning behind current functionality??

Cheers and thanks,

phil p
fields.summary: Implement a save page and continue editing option
Better handling of database unavailability
